b: ^an ancient rapier you found in an Autarch's tomb
^an ornate gilded rifle you won in a bet
^a ritual lyre you were gifted by a Faa

Start: ^You were born in an ancient nest of chrome and glass: one of the arcologies left behind by past generations.

s: ^This favoured birth makes you a true-kin
^This cursed home kept you away from the sun and fresh air

c-0: ^, untouched by the peculiar genetics of the outside Urth.
c-1: ^, blissfully unaware of the wonders outside your walls.

s: ^Though you are told your blood line is favoured

c-2: ^, the tattoos on your face mark you as a servitor. A life of hard labour would have been your fate, had you not fled the old societies to discover your true calling.

g-1: ^ The harsh desert sands have been no kinder than your old life treated you, but at least you are free.

c-10: ^ days of dried rations and water,
^During your previous journeys you gained the mystic gift of healing hands from a psychoactive fungus.

QuestIntro: ^You have been hired as a guide; perhaps a foolish endeavour for someone so unfamiliar with the vast interior desert of Vaarn. Lack of equipment and water drove you to desperate ends.

c-0: ^: deliver an archivist past the crystal mesas to an ancient wreckage. The Felicitous Society Of Generous Vendors provided the task, your directions, and the equipment currently residing on your back. Perhaps the archivists already paid the trade cartel? You didn't bother to ask questions.

c-1: ^, promise of more water payment is all that keeps you walking.

s: ^After a day of walking, you have nearly arrived at the archive.

JourneyStart: ^Blue sand whispers beneath your tired feet as you arrive at your destination. You thank whatever gods are watching that you managed to find it among these snaking arroyos and sinister caves. The bulbous red sun is close to setting, leaving your current path in shade.

s: ^Amongst a large martyr tree grove sits the archive

c-0: ^: a squat hexagonal complex with large hideous eyes carved in relief. One eye seems to watch your approach coldly. An uninviting exterior, but perhaps the inhabitants are charming.

s: ^While regarding the archive you hear the sound of slipping rocks.

c-1: ^ A light chittering sound fades from range as you swivel with alarm. All that catches your eye is a sliding rock falling from a dark cave up the slope to your right.

s: ^Climb up to the cave to investigate.
^Hide and try to spot the source of the noise.

s0: ^You cause minute avelanches of pebels and dust as you slip up the sand towards the small cave. Peering in the dark entrance you can barely see that the walls only extend a few arm lengths back.

b: ^ Putting on your thermal goggles, you see nothing warm and living in the cave. However the faint remnants of warmth on the ground indicate a recent visitor.
^ You pull out your glowstone and you can see the cave is filled with piles of ancient rags and dried feces. The dim green light lets you
^ You step into the gloom and your eyes adjust until you can start to make out the piles of ancient rags and dried feces. Your eyes finish adjusting and you

s0: ^ see one of the piles of rags in the center of the cave is actually a dessicated corpse.
s1: ^ You return to the cave. Nothing has moved from it's prior positions.

s: ^You've entered a cave of death. Flee towards the archive.

WorryingNoises: ^Farther up the arroyo you hear the distant sound of machinery whirring: a worrying new development.
DessicatedCricketCorpse: ^ you can see it was certainly human. The flesh and clothes have long rotted away, and the bones are pitted from chewing
^ glint of light within the ribcage catches your attention.

s: ^Reach into the ribcage to see what treasure you find.

HideFromCricket: ^Your heart pounds in your ears as you strain to listen against the wind. You wait for couple of minutes.
^No more sounds. Nothing stirs except the sand etching it's way into the surrounding rocks.

b: ^You reach into the ribcage, grave dust rubbing against your arm. Your hand pulls out a flat metalic disk. As you rotate it, the surface shimmers with rainbow light. A hole in the center gives the impression of an iris in a metalic eye.
^ It must be some kind of ancient data disc. Perhaps it is something from the archive?

s: ^Pocket the disk. It could come in handy later.
^It is better to leave the dead with their treasures. Leave for the archive.

b: ^As you reach towards the object you hear a scraping and chittering sound behind you. Quickly you draw your
^ and turn to face the sound, but you are not quick enough.

s: ^You feel a sudden heavy weight on your back as some creature jumps onto you.

CricketJumpYou: ^ flail as the squeaking object bashes at the backpack on your shoulders. A horrible squeal reverberates as you manage to get a solid stab at the thing on your back. Falling on the ground you see a quick dark shape leap out of the cave leaving only a large twitching cricket leg on the ground.
^You check your face and arms. No wounds, only spatterings of insect blood. Your backpack did not fair so well. Bite marks tear through the straps and you find yourself one ration short.

s: ^Return to investigate the object in the corpse.
^Better to leave this place while you can.

WaitFromCricket: ^You stay completely still in the sand attempting to control your breathing.
^After a few more minutes of waiting you spot the source of the sound. A large and fat grey cricket clambers up the side of the arroyo towards the cave. You watch as it stands in the entrance.

s: ^Keep watching to see what it does.
^Play music on your lyre to sooth the insect.

c-0: ^The cricket circles the perimeter, and then hops from view away over the edge of the rocky canyon.

s: ^Surely it isn't coming back. Go investigate the cave.
^You don't wish to get eaten. Continue on towards the archive.

c-2: ^You begin idly plucking at your lyre, attempting to look non-threatening. The cricket turns to look at you, antenae wisping about. Suddenly the cricket flees into the cave.

s: ^Obviously this cricket does not enjoy the finer things in life. Continue towards the archive.

AttackCricket: ^You let out an involuntary yell as you begin running up the sand towards the cricket, waving your
^ in front of you. The cricket, apparently in no mood for a fight, lets out a timmid chirp as it flees and leaps into the darkness of the cave.

s: ^It's better to avoid this fight and save your strength. Head towards the archive.

ShootCricket: ^The sound of your rifle reverberates through the arroyos as the grey cricket slumps into the sand. Hopefully that was the only one.

s: ^Perhaps now the cave is safe. Go investigate the cave.
^Better not risk it. Continue on towards the archive.

TakeCorpseDisk: ^You bury the disk in your backpack. A spare rag will hopefully protect it's gleaming surface.
FleeCave: ^You flee from the cave entrance leaving it's mysteries to some other hapless wanderer. Rocks and pebels slide away from your feet as you slip down the sands.

b: ^As you work on maintaining your balance, you suddenly hear a harsh squeaking noise behind you. You quickly draw your
^ and turn to see a fat grey cricket perched in the cave entrance above you. It's threadlike antenae wisp about as your gaze locks.

s: ^ before it does the same to you.
^No time for a fight. Flee towards the archive.

b: ^Rocks and pebels slide away from your feet as you slip down the sands away from the cave.
^You slip down the sands towards the martyr tree grove.
^You run tumbling down the sands away from the cave. With a glance behind, you confirm that nothing is following you. Your pace slows as you approach the martyr trees.
^You slip down the sands hurring away from the sounds. With a glance behind, you confirm your safety. Your pace slows as you approach the martyr trees.

^ Red and water filled fronds bloom off of ashen stalks all around you. You stare through the trees at a carven eye on the archive's wall as the wind creates small crackling sounds in the dried fronds of the tree stalks. Tearing your gaze from the watching eye, on a bloom of crimson fronds nearby you see a profusion of tiny white lumps.

s: ^Investigate the white shapes on the nearby martyr tree.

b: ^ You return to the martyr tree grove surrounding the archive.
^ You slip down the sands towards the martyr tree grove.

SinisterWhirring: ^ As you approach the red trees, and sinister carven eyes of the archive, you hear

b: ^ farther up the arroyo where you first saw the archive
^ Through your thermal goggles you see past the cold landscape and spy the red outline of some boxy machine.

SinisterWhirring: ^ Whatever it is, it is coming down the arroyos closer to your position.

c-0: ^ and wait: eyes scanning through the trees. From out of the canyon staggers a bizzare box shaped synth on two rusting legs. From between it's legs emerges a heavy gun. Antenae waggle in the air as it stops and aims directly at you.

b: ^ You've heard pilgrims refer to this kind of ancient war-synth as a "stumbling drone". Their boxy bodies are said to be easily tippable.

s: ^ before the synth has time to react.

c-0: ^You aim down the sights of your ornate rifle and shoot at the center of the metal box. You hear a loud ping of metal as your bullet richochets off the stumbling synth.

b: ^Next you hear the ethereal crackle of plasma fire ring across your brigandine as you fall to the ground.
^Next you hear the ethereal crackle of plasma fire as the synth blasts a hole through your chest.

c-1: ^You run across the sand towards the stumbling synth. You zig-zag between martyr trees to hopefully avoid

b: ^Your daring run is cut short as a crackling plasma shot rings across your brigandine. You fall head first into the sand.
^Your daring run is cut short as a crackling plasma shot blasts a hole through your stomach.

c-2: ^You fall to the ground and try to flatten yourself against the sand. Just in time. You hear the sickening crackle of plasma shot as a martyr tree behind you explodes into flames.

s: ^Try and shoot the synth with your
^Get up and try to charge at the synth with your

c-1: ^You hide behind a martyr tree that is just wide enough to conceal you. You cautiously watch between the fronds. From out of the canyon staggers a bizzare box shaped synth on two rusting legs. From between it's legs emerges a heavy gun. It's antenae wiggle in the air as it begins circling the perimeter of the grove.

b: ^ You've heard pilgrims refer to this kind of ancient war-synth as a "stumbling drone". Their boxy bodies are said to be easily tippable.

s: ^ before the synth has time to react.
^Sneak behind the synth and try to tip it over.
^Flee towards the archive before it notices you.

c-0: ^You aim down the sights of your ornate rifle and shoot at the center of the metal box. You hear a loud ping of metal as your bullet richochets off the stumbling synth.
^Next you hear the ethereal crackle of plasma fire as a martyr tree explodes into flame and char.
^The boxy synth is begining to stumble towards you through the trees.
c-2: ^Slowly the synth stumbles past the martyr trees. It swivels it's box shaped body around searching. It is nearly at your position, but hasn't seemed to notice you.

KillSynth: ^You quietly pad across the sand until you are directly behind the synth. Quickly you lift it's side with all your strength until the heavy box tips over. You grab the desperately wiggling legs and continue tipping the synth until it is upside down.
^The legs and gun still move, but the synth has no chance of righting itself.

s: ^This synth could have valuable parts to harvest.
^Destroy the synth so it can't attack anyone else.

c-0: ^You tear off it's undercarriage and detach the powercell inside. Not many of the ancient components are cleanly detachable, but this powercell could be quite valuable. You fit it inside your backpack. Hopefully it will be worth the weight it adds.
c-1: ^With a nearby rock you begin bashing the undercarriage of the synth. The legs wiggle in a panic until your rock dismantles some vital component inside.

s: ^The synth is dead. Approach the archive.

ArgentManna: ^You pull a blood red frond towards your eyes to better see the white objects. The white lumps are piles of miniscule crystalized sugar wafers: argent manna.

s: ^Amongst the piles of sugar you see the microscopic black bodies of Themis aphids

c-0: ^ sucking at the frond, and emitting droplets of nectar from their rear. The nectar will soon crystalize into more manna. On the backs of the aphids you see the vague shape of the titan symbol responsible for their name.

s: ^Scraping the argent manna from the fronds could provide you with a day of rations

c-1: ^, but perhaps the archivists intent to harvest it themselves.

s: ^The archivists wouldn't mind. Harvest the argent manna.
^You have enough rations as it is. Continue towards the archive.

HarvestManna: ^, you scrape piles of argent manna into a leather pouch. Many aphids fall as well: they will add vital protein. As you finish filling the pouch, you see movement out of the corner of your eye. Some colorful shadow slides along the ground just out of sight against the archive wall.

s: ^Ignore it. It is time to make contact with the archivists.

c-0: ^You close up your pouch of argent manna and quickly stow it in your backpack as you pad across the sand towards the last position of the shadow. You catch another glimpse of it sliding away from the grove and towards the top of a short ridge. You see the shadow looks almost human, but there is nothing in sight to cast it.

b: ^ Could this be one of the planeyfolk you've read about in poems?
^ Could this be one of the planeyfolk you've heard of in songs?
^ Could this be one of the planeyfolk you've heard of from wanderers and pilgrims?

s: ^Play a song about planeyfolk in case the shadow recognizes it.
^It could be dangerous. Better to make contact with the archivists.

c-1: ^You yell a "hello" to the shadow, but it continues slipping up the side of the ridge.
